title: seasons
comment: The main periods of the year which each have their own distinctive weather. In life, the varied periods of human experience.

children.title: seasons, of the year
children.comment: Distinctive periods of the year marked by certain climatic conditions. Seasons are examples of God's perfect order in the world. They represent the balanced cycle of creation which is sustained by God and through which his provision and mercy are made known.

primaryrefs.comment: The rainy season, accounting for over 90 per cent of the national rainfall, runs from October to March/April. Its beginning is marked by the autumn rains in October/November; the lighter spring showers in April/May announce the coming of the dry season.
Ploughing and sowing take place from October to December when the autumn rains have begun to soften the ground. Most crops are harvested between April and June.

children.title: Spring rain as a sign of blessing

secondaryrefs.comment: The gentle spring rains signal the approach of harvest

children.title: Spring as a time of growth

primaryrefs.comment: Spring marks a pleasant interval between the heavy winter rains and the onset of the dry season.

children.title: Spring as a time for war

secondaryrefs.comment: The time following the spring harvest (May/June), when agricultural commitments are reduced
offering the firstfruits of the barley harvest
The Feast of Weeks celebrated the ingathering of the grain harvest.

children.title: A time for harvesting summer fruit

seealsos.comment: Grapes, olives and figs are harvested in July/September

children.title: A time to store harvested grain
The breaking of the summer drought

primaryrefs.comment: Autumn is the start of the rainy season and corresponds to the time of ploughing and sowing.

children.title: A time when travelling is difficult
Celebration of the Feast of Dedication

secondaryrefs.comment: The Feast of Dedication (Hannukah) commemorates the rededication of the temple by Judas Maccabeus in 165 B.C.

children.title: seasons, of life
children.comment: Appropriate or appointed periods of time which are part of the variety and development of human life and experience and which influence human affairs. The times and seasons for individuals and nations are set by God, who works all things together towards the final fulfilment of his purposes.

children.title: The seasons of life are appointed by God
The seasons of nations and the world
Death comes at its appointed time

secondaryrefs.comment: Christians are to be always ready to share the gospel.

children.title: The rise and fall of nations
The time to receive God's salvation
The appointed time of his birth
The appointed time of his death
The appointed time of his return
